intro: Hieracium brachionotum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and often branched. Hieracium brachionotum is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
